text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
References to ASED for ERCS have been updated to statute date throughout this IRM to match the ﬁeld name in ERCS. There are no other statute dates used in ERCS other than the assessment
Signiﬁcant changes to this IRM are reﬂected in the table below.
“Related Resources” - Penalty Codes for ERCS, clariﬁed the items contained in this ﬁle.

“Statute Date Requirements”: Added to (5), a return cannot be closed from the group with an expired statute. Added Note: If closing a return with Alpha Codes CC, NN, OO or YY and procedures require the statute date be updated to the original statute, even if expired, the statute date can be updated to the expired statute during the ERCS closing process.
“Statute Date Requirements”: Added to (

), a return cannot be closed from the group with an expired statute. Added Note: If closing a return with Alpha Codes CC, NN, OO or YY and procedures require the statute date be updated to the original statute, even if expired, the statute date can be updated to the expired statute during the ERCS closing process.
“Updating the ERCS Statute Date”: (5) updated to reﬂect the ERCS User Handbooks can be found under the Manual and Handbooks chapter of the ERCS book in the Virtual Library.

Original New Reference Description of Change Reference 4.7.3.7 (6) 4.7.3.7 (7) “Statute Reports”: Clariﬁed that the Statute Override Report must be run weekly as the data is overwritten each week. Added a reference to IRM 4.7.6, Reports, for this report. 4.7.3.9 4.7.3.9 “Form 895 Log File”: Added Note: The Form 895 log ﬁle may be maintained electronically as long as it is kept on a secured shared drive accessible by more than one user so it can be retrieved up to the required three years after closure from the group. 4.7.3.10 (2) 4.7.3.10 (2) “Retention Requirements”: Added the Schedule and Item number from Document 12990 for each item subject to retention.
Description of Change
Minor editorial changes have been made throughout this IRM. Some items were reworded for Also, website addresses and IRM references were reviewed and updated, as necessary.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS IRM 4.7.3 dated 5/16/2019 is superseded.
Small Business/Self Employed (SB/SE), Large Business & International (LB&I), and Tax Exempt & Government Entities (TE/GE) shared administrative support employees who use ERCS.
Table of Contents
) This IRM section contains information regarding the establishment of and quirements for control of the statute date for returns on ERCS. (
) Purpose: To provide users the instructions to maintain statute controls monitor statute dates on ERCS. (

) Audience: These procedures apply to IRS employees in SB/SE, LB&I, TE/GE shared administrative support employees who are responsible for statute controls and for monitoring or updating the statute date on returns ERCS. Employees include managers, technical employees, administrative support employees and shared administrative support employees. (
) Policy Owner: The SBSE Deputy Director, Examination, who is under the Director, Headquarters Examination. (
) Program Owner: SB/SE Director, Technology Solutions. (
) Stakeholders: LB&I. (

) Updating and controlling the statute date on ERCS is essential in ensuring there is no loss to the taxpayer or the government from erroneous or barred assessments. To ensure the accuracy of the ERCS data on it is imperative for users to verify the ERCS statute date is correct and timely. (

) Users must be aware of the potential for Unauthorized Access of Taxpayer Accounts (UNAX) violations from the use of ERCS. Data from ERCS accessed only for IRS business purposes. Users should promptly retrieve ERCS reports from printers or fax machines in order to prevent disclosure. Audit trails are created and subject to review for all user of taxpayer data. For more information about UNAX, see IRM
, IRS authorized Access, Attempted Access or Inspection of Taxpayer Records (UNAX) Program Policy, Guidance, and Requirements. (
) IRM
, Examination Process-Assessment Statute of Limitations (

) Responsibilities of managers in regards to statute control for returns under manager’s jurisdiction include, but are not limited to: • Ensuring the correct statute date is properly reﬂected on the case and on ERCS. • Ensuring the correct statute date is on Form
-D, Examination Request-ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, when reviewing the form to add a return to ERCS. • Ensuring Form
, AIMS/ERCS Update (Examination Update), is completed, reviewed and signed for statute date updates. • Processing (approving or disapproving) all statute date updates on ERCS timely. • Ensuring Forms

are generated and returned timely. • Monitoring the ERCS statute reports. . Note: In the absence of administrative support staff the manager has the bility to see that the administrative duties are completed. Internal Revenue Manual
Responsibilities of managers in regards to statute control for returns under the manager’s jurisdiction include, but are not limited to:
Ensuring the correct statute date is properly reﬂected on the case and on ERCS. Ensuring the correct statute date is on Form
-D, Examination Request-ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, when reviewing the form to add a return to ERCS. Ensuring Form
, AIMS/ERCS Update (Examination Update), is completed, reviewed and signed for statute date updates. Processing (approving or disapproving) all statute date updates on ERCS timely. Ensuring Forms
are generated and returned timely. Monitoring the ERCS statute reports. .
In the absence of administrative support staff the manager has the bility to see that the administrative duties are completed.
Examination Returns Control System (

) Responsibilities of the technical employee in the group or function in statute control for all returns in the employee’s inventory include, but are limited to: • Ensuring the correct statute date is on Form

-D, Examination Request-ERCS (Examination Returns Control System) Users, when completing the form to add a return to ERCS. • Ensuring the correct statute date is properly reﬂected on the case and on ERCS. • Ensuring Forms
are checked for accuracy, signed, and returned the manager for review within
calendar days of generation. • Ensuring returns requiring a Form
, Notice of Statute Expiration, have a managerial approved form on the case ﬁle. (

) Responsibilities of administrative support and shared administrative support employees in the group or function in regards to statute control include, but not limited to: • Ensuring the correct statute date is properly reﬂected on the case and on ERCS. • Generating Forms
and forwarding to the appropriate individual completion. • Updating ERCS to indicate when the Forms
have been signed the manager. • Providing the manager with the ERCS statute reports. • Maintaining the Form
log ﬁle. (
) ERCS provides statute controls (Form
controls) and reports (Pending Statute Report and

Report) for all levels of management within the practice area. These controls and reports are used to monitor statute dates prevent a barred assessment that could result in loss of money to the Treasury. Refer to IRM
, Reports, for the recommended usage of the statute reports. (
) ERCS contains security checks that restrict a user’s access to only what need in order to perform their official duties and responsibilities. Refer to
, Security for information and requirements to gain access to the system. (

, Examination Process-Assessment Statute of Limitations Controls • Penalty Codes for ERCS contains a listing of ERCS nationally deﬁned penalty Master File Tax (MFT) codes with Internal Revenue Code sec- tion, deﬁnitions, statute requirements, and Form
, Assessment Abatement of Miscellaneous Civil Penalties, requirements. (

) In the group or function, the manager and the revenue agent, tax compliance officer, tax examiner, or audit accounting aide, etc. (hereinafter referred to as technical employee) assigned control of the return are jointly responsible for the control of the statute date. (
) When a Form
, Notice of Statute Expiration, is generated on ERCS the “Date Issued” is set to today’s date. The “Date Returned” must be updated ERCS to the date the manager initialed the Form
. The “Date Issued” “Date Returned” are used by area and headquarters analysts to monitor statute controls, so it is imperative ERCS is updated accurately and timely. (
) Use the option “Acknowledge the Issuance or Return of a Form

” to input speciﬁc date for the “Date Returned”. The options “Correct a Single Tax Return” or “Correct Multiple Tax Returns” toggle the date returned indicator which sets the “Date Returned” to today’s date. (
) These dates are displayed on the “Full Display of Multiple Returns” screen.
4.7.3.1.7 (06-24-2022) Related Resources

In the group or function, the manager and the revenue agent, tax officer, tax examiner, or audit accounting aide, etc. (hereinafter referred to technical employee) assigned control of the return are jointly responsible for the control of the statute date. When a Form
, Notice of Statute Expiration, is generated on ERCS the “Date Issued” is set to today’s date. The “Date Returned” must be updated ERCS to the date the manager initialed the Form

. The “Date Issued” “Date Returned” are used by area and headquarters analysts to monitor statute controls, so it is imperative ERCS is updated accurately and timely. Use the option “Acknowledge the Issuance or Return of a Form

” to speciﬁc date for the “Date Returned”. The options “Correct a Single Tax Return” or “Correct Multiple Tax Returns” toggle the date returned indicator which sets the “Date Returned” to today’s date. These dates are displayed on the “Full Display of Multiple Returns” screen.
These dates are displayed on the “Full Display of Multiple Returns” screen.
Examination Returns Control System (

) All statute date updates on ERCS must be approved or disapproved timely. Timely is generally within two days of notiﬁcation. Notiﬁcation can be by an ERCS message when signing on or by notiﬁcation from the ERCS user the changes requiring approval. (

) The statute date must be veriﬁed before approving a new requisition on If the statute date is incorrect on a requisition, the manager should skip the return on the ERCS approval screen and instruct the administrative support personnel to update the statute date. The requisition can then be processed. (
) When a return is received from the Campus or other function with an statute date, the manager is required to ensure a Form
is completed. The manager is required to review and sign the form and give the form to administrative support personnel to update the statute date on ERCS. (
) Managers are required to ensure a completed Form
is attached to the case ﬁle for all returns requiring a Notice of Statute Expiration no later than
days prior to the statute date (
days for Centralized Case Processing (CCP)). The ERCS
Report and the Pending Statute Report are used to monitor returns needing a Form
) Once the Form
is generated, the manager is required to ensure the technical employee assigned control of the return completes the form and returns it to the manager for approval within
calendar days. (
) When the manager receives the Form
from the technical employee assigned control of the return, the manager has an additional
calendar (or
calendar days from the date the form was issued) to review the form accuracy, initial it, and give it to the administrative support personnel for ac- knowledgement in ERCS. (
) When a prompt assessment statute date is input on ERCS, the manager is required to notify the administrative support personnel as soon as the update is approved so a Form
may be printed for the return. (
) The manager is required to monitor the Statute Override Report weekly to verify the ERCS statute date is correct. (
) If the statute date needs to be updated, the technical employee is required prepare Form
and give it to the manager for review and approval. If a Employee Form
already exists for the return, the technical employee should follow the procedures in IRM
, Examination Process-Assessment Statute of Limitations Controls, to update the form. (

) When a return is received from the Campus or other function, the tive support personnel or other receiving individual is required to verify the Support statute date. If the statute date is inaccurate, the return is to be given to the manager for appropriate action. (
) After receipt of a signed Form

from the manager for a statute date update, the administrative support personnel is required to timely update the statute date on ERCS. (Generally, for an statute date update, timely is the same day.) (
) The administrative support personnel in each group or function must Forms
from ERCS with sufficient frequency to ensure that a completed Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
N
Examination Returns Control System (ERCS)
The administrative support personnel in each group or function must generate Forms 895 from ERCS with sufficient frequency to ensure that a completed
Form
is in place no later than
days prior to the expiration of the statute date (
days for CCP). For more information about returns a Form
, see IRM
, Returns Subject to Statute Control. Note: If the local area office is using
days or more for their locally deﬁned number of days and the
forms are generated monthly, ERCS ensures Form
is generated for returns that have at least
days left on the statute date. The phrase “locally deﬁned number of days” is explained in
), Statute Reports. (
) Upon receipt of the signed Form
from the manager, the administrative support personnel has
calendar days to initial and date the form and input the date the manager initialed the form into ERCS. This is the “Date ﬁeld on the ERCS system. (
) The administrative support personnel has the responsibility to run the ate statute reports described in IRM
, Statute Reports, and take appropriate actions. (
) The administrative support personnel is required to place a copy of the completed Form
in the log ﬁle. If the form on the case ﬁle is updated, all copies of the Form
must be retained in the log ﬁle. See
, Retention Requirements, for the log ﬁle retention requirements. (
) IRM
, contains rules for setting and using alpha coded statute dates. Document
, IRS Processing Codes and Information, contains rules for setting statute dates based on form numbers and MFTs. This section additional ERCS requirements. (

) The following rules apply for setting or updating the statute date on ERCS: • When a return is requested or updated the statute date must be later than today. • A numeric statute date is required for returns with an MFT
, a Code
, and Push Code

• When a skeletal Audit Information Management System (AIMS) is added to ERCS during AIMS to ERCS processing the statute date the ERCS record is set using the MFT, activity code, and tax period based on a timely ﬁled return. Note: AIMS does not carry an Assessment Statute Expiration Date (ASED) until the return is fully established. • When a full AIMS estate record is added to ERCS during AIMS to ERCS processing, the statute date is set based on the date of death. Note: AIMS skeletal estate returns cannot be added to ERCS the date of death is not set until the AIMS record is fully lished. • The numeric statute date must be within
days of expiration in to update to an alpha code on AIMS and ERCS with the following ex- ceptions: (
) Alpha Code EE, No Return Filed, (
) Alpha Code QQ, “Docketed Case”, (
) Alpha Code XX, ERCS Penalty Control where
Note: AIMS does not carry an Assessment Statute Expiration Date (ASED) until the return is fully established.

lished.

The numeric statute date must be within 210 days of expiration in order to update to an alpha code on AIMS and ERCS with the following ex- ceptions: (1) Alpha Code EE, No Return Filed, (2) Alpha Code QQ, “Docketed Case”, (3) Alpha Code XX, ERCS Penalty Control where the

) The following rules apply to the statute restriction type: • AIMS and ERCS allow input of an R at the end of a statute date to indicate the date is restricted to a set of issues or ﬂow through • R is not valid with an EE alpha code. • R is not valid on the original statute date. (
) The following rules apply for transfers: • There must be at least
days left on the statute date in order to transfer a return to LB&I. • There must be at least
days left on the statute date in order to transfer a return to SB/SE, Specialty, or the Campus if the ARC is Audit Reconsideration. • There must be at least
months left on the statute date in order to transfer a return to SB/SE, Specialty, or the Campus if the ARC is

, Audit Reconsideration. • Alpha Code FF, “Reference Return”, is not valid for transfers to area. Note: If the statute date does not have the required number of days/months left the statute and the gaining office approves the transfer, the statute date is updated to Alpha Code ZZ which will allow the transfer.

If the statute date does not have the required number of days/months left on the statute and the gaining office approves the transfer, the statute date is updated to Alpha Code ZZ which will allow the transfer.

Reminder: Contact your local AIMS/ERCS staff for assistance closing cases with a barred statute.
) When a return is ﬁled, the ASED is set on Master File (MF) based on the the return was received by the IRS. The MF ASED is sent to AIMS on the opening record. (
) When a new requisition is established on ERCS or when collateral or control records are added to ERCS, the statute date must be input at the of the requisition. (

) When the AIMS record changes from skeletal to a fully established record, statute dates on AIMS and ERCS are compared during the AIMS to ERCS cessing. If the AIMS and ERCS statutes are different, the format for each is checked and either AIMS or ERCS is updated. (
) The following shows the priority order used to determine which statute date keep, starting with the highest priority: • Type

statutes • Alpha code statutes, excluding EE • Irregular numeric statute dates (irregular statute date is any statute other than a statute date set based on a timely ﬁled return; includes prompt assessments and late ﬁled returns) • Numeric statute dates based on a timely ﬁled return • Alpha Code EE Example: If ERCS has a numeric statute date and AIMS has an Alpha Code the AIMS ASED overwrites the ERCS statute date. Conversely, if has a numeric ASED and ERCS has an Alpha Code AA statute date, ERCS sends an update to AIMS. (
) If both AIMS and ERCS fall into the same priority, the ERCS statute date is kept unless both AIMS and ERCS have an irregular statute date, in which the earliest date is kept. (

) After the initial comparison of AIMS and ERCS, all subsequent statute date differences in the following weeks are resolved as follows: • If a statute date is updated on ERCS and the manager has not approved the update, no action is taken to resolve the AIMS and differences. • If an ASED is updated on AIMS, the AIMS ASED overwrites ERCS the return is listed on the Statute Override Report. • If the statute date was updated on ERCS and the update is over

days old (indicating the initial update rejected), another update is AIMS. Note: If a return is listed on the AAC Difference Report, differences between AIMS and ERCS are not resolved during AIMS to Internal Revenue Manual
Alpha code statutes, excluding EE
Irregular numeric statute dates (irregular statute date is any statute other than a statute date set based on a timely ﬁled return; includes prompt assessments and late ﬁled returns)
Numeric statute dates based on a timely ﬁled return
Alpha Code EE
After the initial comparison of AIMS and ERCS, all subsequent statute date differences in the following weeks are resolved as follows:

If a statute date is updated on ERCS and the manager has not approved the update, no action is taken to resolve the AIMS and ERCS differences. If an ASED is updated on AIMS, the AIMS ASED overwrites ERCS and the return is listed on the Statute Override Report. If the statute date was updated on ERCS and the update is over
days old (indicating the initial update rejected), another update is sent to AIMS.
Note: If a return is listed on the AAC Difference Report, differences between AIMS and ERCS are not resolved during AIMS to
Examination Returns Control System (ERCS)
processing. AIMS assignee code (AAC) differences must be resolved timely to prevent delays in reconciling statute date dif- ferences between AIMS and ERCS.
resolved timely to prevent delays in reconciling statute date dif- ferences between AIMS and ERCS. (
) IRM
, AIMS Error Reports, contains detailed descriptions of the mentioned in this section. (
) If the statute date needs to be updated the group or function must prepare Form

The completed form and all documents necessary to support the statute date update are to be given to the manager for approval. After approval by the manager, the administrative support personnel must update the statute date on ERCS. Approval of the ERCS update is covered in IRM
, Approving the ERCS Statute Date. After approval by the the statute date updates are sent to AIMS. This is done daily by the AIMS/ ERCS staff in each area. (
) There are several reasons a statute date may need to be updated on the ERCS system. These include: • Updating to an alpha code when the statute date on the return is
days of expiration (ERCS allows an alpha code to be input if the statute date is within
days of expiration so the Forms

are printed with the alpha code statute date.) • Updating to an Alpha Code ZZ in order to transfer a return out of the area • Updating to a numeric statute date when a return has been transferred into the area with an Alpha Code ZZ • Updating the statute date after securing a Form

, Consent to the Time to Assess Tax • Updating to a numeric statute date from an Alpha Code EE when a return is ﬁled • Updating to an earlier statute date after a request for a prompt assess- ment • Adding the statute restriction indicator • Correcting an incorrect statute date • Issuing of a statutory notice of deﬁciency (
) Audit trails are created when the statute date is updated on ERCS. (
) If the statute date is changed after a Form
has been generated, the form must be updated to the new statute date. Completion requirements for Form
can be found in IRM

) The ERCS input screen for updating the statute date on ERCS can be found the “Correct or Display Records” chapter of the ERCS User Handbooks which can be found under the Manual and Handbooks chapter of the ERCS book in the Virtual Library. (

) Users with write and approval permissions may update a statute date; however, they cannot approve their own updates. For example, statute date changes made by managers on ERCS must be approved on ERCS by the next higher level manager, typically the territory manager (TM). (
) When a manager approves a requisition, they are required to ensure the statute date is correct. There is a possibility that the ERCS statute date on a Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
N
If the statute date needs to be updated the group or function must immediately prepare Form

The completed form and all documents necessary to support the statute date update are to be given to the manager for approval. After approval by the manager, the administrative support personnel must update the statute date on ERCS. Approval of the ERCS update is covered in IRM
, Approving the ERCS Statute Date. After approval by the manager, the statute date updates are sent to AIMS. This is done daily by the AIMS/ ERCS staff in each area.
(06-24-2022) Updating the ERCS Statute Date
Updating to an alpha code when the statute date on the return is
days of expiration (ERCS allows an alpha code to be input if the statute date is within
days of expiration so the Forms

are printed with the alpha code statute date.) Updating to an Alpha Code ZZ in order to transfer a return out of the area Updating to a numeric statute date when a return has been into the area with an Alpha Code ZZ Updating the statute date after securing a Form

, Consent to the Time to Assess Tax Updating to a numeric statute date from an Alpha Code EE when a return is ﬁled Updating to an earlier statute date after a request for a prompt ment Adding the statute restriction indicator Correcting an incorrect statute date Issuing of a statutory notice of deﬁciency
When a manager approves a requisition, they are required to ensure the statute date is correct. There is a possibility that the ERCS statute date on a

requisition may overwrite the AIMS ASED when the return is fully established on AIMS. Since the ERCS statute date is approved with the requisition, ERCS does not require the manager to approve the statute date a second time when the AIMS record is fully established, nor does ERCS notify the manager if the AIMS ASED is overwritten with the ERCS statute date. See IRM
, Comparing the ASED on AIMS and ERCS, for a more detailed description of when the ERCS statute date overwrites the AIMS ASED.
The ERCS statute reports along with the AIMS Tables
and
, Returns with Statute Date Pending, are designed to provide users with the necessary tools to monitor statutes, enforce statute requirements, identify potential issues, and ensure Form
procedures are followed timely. This section gives a brief description of the following ERCS statute reports:
with Statute Date Pending, are designed to provide users with the necessary tools to monitor statutes, enforce statute requirements, identify potential and ensure Form
procedures are followed timely. This section gives a description of the following ERCS statute reports: •
Report • AIMS-ERCS Statute Report • BBA Partnership Statute Report • Pending Statute Report • Pending Statute Report (Territory) • Statute Override Report Note: The
Report, AIMS-ERCS Statute Report, BBA Partnership Statute Report, and Pending Statute Report can be found under the Statute tion Reports option on the Manager’s Reports menu. (
) The
Report should be run at least monthly to monitor returns requiring a Form
and to ensure that each return in inventory has satisﬁed the control requirements. This report includes returns with expired and alpha statute dates. Refer to IRM
Report, for more information. (

) The AIMS-ERCS Statute Report should be run weekly as the AIMS data is refreshed each week. The report lists returns where the AIMS and ERCS statute dates differ or where the date may have a potential error. ERCS only returns, such as penalty controls or dropped AIMS returns, are not included this report. Refer to IRM
, AIMS-ERCS Statute Report, for more mation about the types of statute issues included on this report. (

) The Bipartisan Budget Act (BBA) Partnership Statute Report should be run monthly. The report lists BBA returns containing a ﬁnal partnership (FPA) deadline date expiring within the user-entered number of days
and
) or all returns with an FPA deadline date. Refer to IRM
, BBA Partnership Statute Report, for more information. (

) The Pending Statute Report should be run at least monthly. The report is to monitor imminent statutes to ensure that statute dates will not expire on returns controlled on ERCS. This includes returns not controlled on AIMS as penalty records. This report may be run at the territory level. Refer to IRM
, Pending Statute Report, for more information.
Caution: The Pending Statute Report does not list expired statute dates, alpha codes, or irregular statute dates unless the irregular statute date falls
Examination Returns Control System (ERCS)

within the deﬁned number of days. Some alpha codes represent an un- derlying statute date that can expire (for example, BB, DD, or MM). Therefore, managers should be aware the Pending Statute Report does not provide data on all statute dates which are expiring within the time frame speciﬁed when the report is run. Managers should use the
Report to identify alpha codes expiring within a short period of time. (

) The Pending Statute Report from the Territory Reports menu should be run at least monthly. It is used by TMs, Directors of Field Operations (DFOs), Area and Practice Area Directors, and Planning and Special Programs (PSP) to monitor imminent statute dates on returns. This report provides a count of returns by AAC expiring within
days grouped by number of days. There is an option to include a listing of returns with expired statute dates and with statute dates expiring within
days. Alpha codes are not included on this report. Returns with irregular statutes are not included on the report, unless statute date falls within
days. Refer to IRM
, Pending Statute Report, for more information. (

) The Statute Override Report from the AIMS Error Reports menu must be run weekly as the data is overwritten each week. It is used to alert the manager when the statute date on ERCS is overwritten by the AIMS ASED. Refer to IRM
, SDOV (Statute Override) Report, for more information. See IRM
, Comparing the ASED on AIMS and ERCS, for details. (

The statute date is expiring within a deﬁned number of days. The statute date is an alpha code, excluding ZZ, or an
type code. The Alpha Code is ZZ and the calculated statute date based on a timely ﬁled return is expiring within a deﬁned number of days.

The statute date is expiring within a deﬁned number of days. The statute date is an alpha code, excluding ZZ, or an 872 type code. The Alpha Code is ZZ and the calculated statute date based on a timely ﬁled return is expiring within a deﬁned number of days.

The deﬁned number of days used to generate Forms 895 on ERCS for the group and PSP is set by each area or by LB&I. The number of days must be between 180 and 400 days. It is recommended it be set to 210 days to make sure all returns have at least 180 days left on the statute date when the
Note: The deﬁned number of days used to generate Forms 895 on ERCS for Technical Services is 210 days.
Note: The deﬁned number of days used to generate Forms 895 on ERCS for CCP is 120 days.
